badge_template_activities.title: - Possess a current qualifying Microsoft Certification

- Maintain active MCT status by enrolling or renewing in the MCT Program on an annual basis

badge_template_activities.title: The nominee shared experiences, best practices, lessons learned, a Day in the Life.
They helped answer questions related to being a new hire in their role.
The nominee shared role-related resources (i.e. Teams sites, communities, etc.)
They introduced the new hire to their network and helped them build a global network within the broader community.
They assisted with tools, processes, role tasks, etc.
The nominee provided insight into relevant stakeholders, sales processes, how to navigate the matrix of different organizations and roles.
The nominee provided opportunities for the new hire to Job Shadow.
Must be a Microsoft full-time employee.

badge_template.description: Earners of the OpenHack: Migration badge understand how to execute an end-to-end migration through optimization. badge_template.description: This exam is for candidates who are experienced in implementing an infrastructure solution in Microsoft Azure. Passing this exam validates a candidate’s ability to design, implement, and manage Azure App Service Apps, Azure Resource Manager Virtual Machines, storage strategies, Azure Active Directory, virtual networks, and ARM templates.
badge_template.name: Exam 533: Implementing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions

badge_template_activities.title: VALIDATE SKILLS IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS:
- Design and deploy ARM templates
- Implement virtual networks
- Implement an Azure Active Directory
- Design and implement a storage strategy
- Create and manage Azure Resource Manager Virtual Machines
- Design and implement Azure App Service apps

badge_template.description: Earners of the MCSE: Cloud Platform and Infrastructure certification have demonstrated the skills required to run a highly efficient and modern data center, with expertise in cloud technologies, identity management, systems management, virtualization, storage and networking. Earning this certification qualifies an individual for such jobs as cloud administrator, cloud architect, computer support specialist, and information security analyst.
badge_template.name: MCSE: Cloud Platform and Infrastructure — Certified 2017

badge_template_activities.title: - MCSA: Windows Server 2012
- MCSA: Cloud Platform
- MCSA: Linux on Azure
AND pass one of the listed elective exams
EARN ONE OF THE FOLLOWING MICROSOFT CERTIFIED SOLUTIONS ASSOCIATE (MCSA) CERTIFICATIONS:
- MCSA: Windows Server 2016

badge_template.description: Earners of the MCSE: Cloud Platform and Infrastructure certification have demonstrated the skills required to run a highly efficient and modern data center, with expertise in cloud technologies, identity management, systems management, virtualization, storage and networking. Earning this certification qualifies an individual for such jobs as cloud administrator, cloud architect, computer support specialist, and information security analyst.

badge_template_activities.title: - MCSA: Cloud Platform

badge_template.description: Passing Exam 346: Managing Office 365 Identities and Requirements validates the skills and knowledge required to provision Office 365, implement networking and security in Office 365, monitor and troubleshoot Office 365 availability and usage, manage cloud identities using Azure AD Connect, and manage federated identities for SSO.
badge_template.name: Exam 346: Managing Office 365 Identities and Requirements

badge_template_activities.title: - Monitor and troubleshoot Office 365 availability and usage
- Manage cloud identities
- Implement and manage identities by using Azure AD Connect
- Implement and manage federated identities for single sign-on (SSO)
VALIDATE SKILLS IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS:
- Provision Office 365
- Plan and implement networking and security in Office 365

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 2 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

badge_template.description: Passing Exam 347: Enabling Office 365 Services validates the skills and knowledge to evaluate, plan, deploy, and operate Office 365 services, including its dependencies, requirements, and supporting technologies. Candidates demonstrate the ability to plan for and configure Exchange Online and Skype for Business online, provision SharePoint Online site collections, and manage clients and end-user devices.
badge_template.name: Exam 347: Enabling Office 365 Services

badge_template_activities.title: VALIDATE SKILLS IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS:
- Manage clients and end-user devices
- Provision SharePoint Online site collections
- Configure Exchange Online and Skype for Business Online for end users
- Plan for Exchange Online and Skype for Business Online
- Configure and secure Office 365 services

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 2 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

badge_template.description: Earners of the MCSA: Office 365 certification have demonstrated the skills required to transition to and administer cloud-hosted business applications with Microsoft 365. They are qualified for a position as a (SaaS) administrator or cloud applications administrator focused on managing Office 365 business productivity products like SharePoint, Exchange, and Skype for Business.
badge_template.name: MCSA: Office 365 - Certified 2016

badge_template_activities.title: Pass Exam 346: Managing Office 365 Identities and Requirements
Pass Exam 347: Enabling Office 365 Services

badge_template.description: Passing Exam 417: Upgrading Your Skills to MCSA Windows Server 2012 validates the skills and knowledge required to implement the Windows Server 2012 core infrastructure services. Candidates have already earned a qualifying Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2003, Windows Server 2000, or Windows XP certification.
badge_template.name: Exam 417: Upgrading Your Skills to MCSA Windows Server 2012

badge_template_activities.title: - Implement business continuity and disaster recovery
- Configure network services, access, and information protection solutions
VALIDATE SKILLS IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS:
- Deploy, manage, and maintain servers, server roles, and features
- Configure Hyper-V
- Install, configure, and manage Active Directory
- Configure file and storage solutions
- Configure and manage network policy server infrastructure, group policy, and high availability

badge_template.description: Earners of the MCSA: Windows Server 2012 certification have demonstrated the skills required to reduce IT costs and deliver more business. They are qualified for a position as a network or computer systems administrator or as a computer network specialist.
badge_template.name: MCSA: Windows Server 2012 - Certified 2016

badge_template_activities.title: Pass Exam 410: Installing and Configuring Windows Server 2012
Pass Exam 412: Configuring Advanced Windows Server 2012 Services
Pass Exam 411: Administering Windows Server 2012

badge_template.description: Passing Exam 246: Monitoring and Operating a Private Cloud with System Center 2012 validates experience with Windows Server, System Center 2012, security, high-availability, fault tolerance, and networking experience in an enterprise environment. Candidates demonstrate the ability to configure data center process automation, deploy resource monitoring and manage configuration and protection.
badge_template.name: Exam 246: Monitoring and Operating a Private Cloud with System Center 2012

badge_template_activities.title: - Deploy resource monitoring
- Monitor resources
- Configure and maintain service management
- Manage configuration and protection
VALIDATE SKILLS IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS:
- Configure data center process automation
